title: The Widow Maria and Her Children
description: The family you help in the first mission

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (You find the house—if you can call it that. A single room with walls of mud brick, a cloth for a door.)

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (Inside, you hear children's voices. One is crying.)

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: (A woman appears at the doorway. Her face is gaunt, her eyes hollow, but she holds herself with dignity.)

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: Who are you? What do you want?

choices.text: The Archbishop sent me. I have bread for you.
The Church hasn't forgotten you, Maria.
I... I have something for you. From St. Sophia.

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: (Her eyes widen.) The Archbishop? Chrysostom sent you?

direct_approach.speaker: You
direct_approach.text: He said to tell you the Church remembers you. And that your husband's soul is with Christ.

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: (She covers her mouth. Tears spill from her eyes.)

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: I thought... I thought God had forgotten us.

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: My husband, Theodoros—he was a good man. He fell loading cargo at the harbor.

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: They didn't even pay what they owed him. Said he was dead, so what did it matter?

direct_approach.speaker: You
direct_approach.text: (You hand her the bread. It's fresh, wrapped in linen.)

direct_approach.speaker: Child
direct_approach.text: (A small boy, maybe five years old, peers around his mother's legs.)

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: Yes, little one. It's bread. We're going to eat today.

direct_approach.speaker: You
direct_approach.text: (The child starts crying. Not from sadness—from relief.)

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: (To you) What is your name? I will pray for you every day.

direct_approach.speaker: You
direct_approach.text: {playerName}. But... I don't need prayers. I'm not—

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: Everyone needs prayers. Even those who don't believe it.

direct_approach.speaker: Maria
direct_approach.text: (She takes your hand.) You carried bread. That makes you an angel today.

direct_approach.speaker: You
direct_approach.text: (You don't know what to say. No one has ever called you an angel.)

direct_approach.speaker: System
direct_approach.text: Return to Chrysostom at Hagia Sophia.

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: The Church? But I... I haven't been to Liturgy since Theodoros died. I couldn't leave the children.

gentle_approach.speaker: You
gentle_approach.text: Chrysostom knows. He sent bread for you and the little ones.

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: (Her hands tremble as she takes the bundle.)

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: I prayed. Every night, I prayed. I thought no one was listening.

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: (Two more children appear—a girl, perhaps seven, holding the hand of a toddler.)

gentle_approach.speaker: Girl
gentle_approach.text: Mama, who is that? Are they from Papa's ship?

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: No, Anastasia. They're from the church. They brought us food.

gentle_approach.speaker: Girl
gentle_approach.text: (She looks at you with eyes too old for her face.)

gentle_approach.speaker: Girl
gentle_approach.text: Thank you. I was trying to be brave for Mama, but I was so hungry.

gentle_approach.speaker: You
gentle_approach.text: (Your throat tightens. You were going to steal today. Instead, you're here.)

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: Tell the Archbishop... tell him we will come to Liturgy. As soon as I can walk that far.

gentle_approach.speaker: Maria
gentle_approach.text: Tell him Maria of Chalcedon will light a candle for him every feast day until she dies.

gentle_approach.speaker: System
gentle_approach.text: Return to Chrysostom at Hagia Sophia.

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: You're not from the Church. You're... you're like us, aren't you? Poor.

humble_approach.speaker: You
humble_approach.text: I'm... I was a thief. The Archbishop caught me and sent me here instead of to the guards.

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: (She laughs—a sound like water in a dry land.)

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: A thief bringing bread. That sounds like something Chrysostom would do.

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: He preaches that God loves the sinners most of all. I never understood until now.

humble_approach.speaker: You
humble_approach.text: (You hand her the bread. She holds it like it's made of gold.)

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: My children haven't eaten in two days. The youngest stopped crying yesterday. That scared me most of all.

humble_approach.speaker: You
humble_approach.text: (You say nothing. What is there to say?)

humble_approach.speaker: Child
humble_approach.text: (A small boy totters out. He's thin—too thin. When he sees the bread, he makes a sound that isn't quite a word.)

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: Yes, Petros. Bread. We have bread.

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: (To you) You saved my son's life today. You know that?

humble_approach.speaker: Maria
humble_approach.text: No. You carried life. Don't ever forget that.

humble_approach.speaker: System
humble_approach.text: Return to Chrysostom at Hagia Sophia.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: {playerName}! Children, come see—our friend is here!

lines.speaker: Child
lines.text: (The children run to the door. They look healthier—still thin, but their eyes are brighter.)

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: The deacon came yesterday. He's helping us find work. And the church brought more food.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: It's because of you. Because you told them about us.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: Chrysostom already knew. I just... I was the messenger.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: The messenger matters. Don't you see? Anyone can know about suffering. Few will do something.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: You did something. You chose to help when you could have walked away.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: That choice—that's what makes us human. That's what Theodoros used to say.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: He sounds like a wise man.

lines.speaker: Maria
lines.text: He was. And he would have liked you. He always said God sends help in strange packages.

lines.speaker: Girl
lines.text: (Anastasia tugs your sleeve.) Will you stay for supper? We have lentils now!

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (You look at their meager home. They have so little—and they want to share it.)

choices.text: I can't stay, but thank you.

stay_for_supper.speaker: Maria
stay_for_supper.text: Come in, come in. It's not much, but it's warm.

stay_for_supper.speaker: You
stay_for_supper.text: (You share a simple meal of lentils and bread. The children chatter about their days.)

stay_for_supper.speaker: You
stay_for_supper.text: (For a moment, in this poor room with this broken family, you feel something you've never felt.)

stay_for_supper.speaker: System
stay_for_supper.text: ✦ You shared a meal with Maria and her children. ✦

polite_decline.speaker: Maria
polite_decline.text: Of course. You have your own life to live. But know this—you are always welcome here.

polite_decline.speaker: Maria
polite_decline.text: Our door is open to you. Always.

polite_decline.speaker: System
polite_decline.text: ✦ You left the family in better spirits. ✦
